Andre - FYI you'll probably discover this on monday. SWT is switching to the 
jar plugin format. The Mac has a compile error in org.eclipse.ui.carbon as a 
result. See comment 19.

Pascal can explain why - related to the way Releng constructs the build 
classpath to compile your fragment by adding all the SWT fragments - and 
apparently it finds the Callback class from the GTK64 fragment first. Which 
happens to return a long and not an int. Thus compile error. Problem could 
occur with any plugin trying to use non API whose signature is fragment 
specific.

Pascal: if you plan to open a Core bug report to track this please past the 
number here.

HP is broken as a result of the new jar plugin. Opened bug 88672 against Core 
to address this problem.


The problem is that the ant tasks jar and zip don't retain the executable flag 
on the swt native libraries. The native libraries don't have the correct 
property when Eclipse attempts to load them. HP checks this property and fails 
to execute.

The SWT build.xml 'standalone download' task uses the native zip executable 
with the following options on Linux/Unix.

		<exec dir="${temp.folder}/swtdownload" executable="zip">
			<arg line="-r -q -y ${destination}/swt-${buildid}-
${os}-${ws}.zip ."/>
		</exec>

The problem is not in the SWT build.xml - we don't jar the fragment ourselves. 
It is done above us.
